title: zsh unit tests failing on develop
body:
The `zsh` unit tests are failing on develop. If you look at https://travis-ci.org/spack/spack/jobs/639262160, you'll see:
```
Testing setup-env.sh with zsh5
---------------------------------
'which spack' succeeds ... SUCCESS

...

Testing activate and deactivate together
---------------------------------
Testing 'spack env activate spack_test_env'
'SPACK_ENV' is set ... SUCCESS
Testing 'spack env deactivate'
'SPACK_ENV' is not set ... FAIL
SPACK_ENV was set:
    SPACK_ENV
Testing 'spack env activate spack_test_env'
'SPACK_ENV' is set ... SUCCESS
Testing 'despacktivate'
'SPACK_ENV' is not set ... FAIL
SPACK_ENV was set:
    SPACK_ENV
Testing 'spack env activate --prompt spack_test_env'
'SPACK_ENV' is set ... SUCCESS
'SPACK_OLD_PS1' is set ... SUCCESS
Testing 'despacktivate'
'SPACK_ENV' is not set ... FAIL
SPACK_ENV was set:
    SPACK_ENV
'SPACK_OLD_PS1' is not set ... FAIL
SPACK_OLD_PS1 was set:
    SPACK_OLD_PS1
Removing test environment before exiting.
==> Error: No environment is currently active.
==> Successfully removed environment 'spack_test_env'
Cleanup
---------------------------------
Removing test packages before exiting.
==> Successfully uninstalled b@1.0%gcc@4.8 arch=linux-ubuntu14.04-haswell/wvu3a4j
==> Successfully uninstalled a@2.0%gcc@4.8+bvv foo=bar foobar=bar arch=linux-ubuntu14.04-haswell/nv64iat
44 tests succeeded.
4 tests failed.
FAIL
```
I think part of the problem is that we are detecting the shell as `zsh5`, not `zsh`. Also, the unit tests are failing, but Travis passes, and I'm not sure why.  We have `bash -e` in the shebang, so it _should_ exit immediately with the proper exit code if one of the commands fails.

@tgamblin
